alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fayette and southern Lamar Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 936 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Winfield to near Bluff to near Vernon. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Vernon, Millport, Berry, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Belk, Bankston, Bluff, Ashcraft Corner, Boley Springs, Blooming Grove, Crossville, Cody, Stone Wall, Wayside, Richard Arthur Field, Fayette County Public Lake and Star. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
